text: hi there. i have created a data capture form (3pages) in nextjs. can i host the next js code on HubSpot? point a url to it??
The only thing I can think of right now is doing a javascript redirect, but this will mess up some tracking stuff of course

Does this link to your question?
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Create-a-contact-via-API-and-associating-with-cookie-based/m-p/230719>
<@U011XCMCTDK> Did you ever solve this issue?

Is something broken at the API level this morning, status page says everything is good to go, but the import I submitted for testing this morning was processed extremely slowly and now I'm getting a weird MySQL error message:
```Import submission result (InternalServerError): {"status":"error","message":"MySQL Circuit breaker is open for [namespace=FileManager, type=FileManager, host=app-group-prod-iad.vt.svc.iad02.k8s.run]","errorType":"IO_ERROR","correlationId":"8e6851df-ef9e-4654-9346-6d9cd3e752be"}```
This appears to have passed, imports are processing normally again...

Another import question - I'm currently running into an issue where when I import a contact that already exists, the 'marketing status' is being set to either true/false (depending on the import request marketableContactImport flag).  My current workaround for this is to set that flag as false, specify 'skipIfKnownColumn' on the 'hs_marketable_status' column mapping and finally specify the 'hs_marketable_status' property as true for all outgoing records.  This -appears- to avoid changing existing user's flags while continuing to set new users with the marketable status.  Does this sound like the correct / supported approach, or is there some better option I'm missing?  This isn't an issue when we use the standard batch based contact updates, but those are too slow for my use case.

hi <@U02412A8Q3V> - the client doesnt have HubSpot cms.

been told they want to set this up as a custom landing page. but we have built it as a SPA in nextjs.
any suggestions how we can uplaod this to HubSpot landing page?
I think that's the reason why. Perhaps you could contact HubSpot Technical Support just to double check. I tried installing on free demo accounts but it was an unsuccessful attempt

Are there any plans to make webhooks for *property definition* updates? For example, if the type changes from string to number, or add/removed options from drop downs?
Also, is there an alternate way to do that other than polling?
I don't think this is possible, the only thing you could do is just recreate everything, but you won't have any nextjs posibilities
